column1: Deals API - Possible to create a new deal without mandatory fields
column27:
The system allows creating a new deal without mandatory fields (assignee__user, company_name_text, company_name_text, name_text, order_number, status_option_status, visible_to_list_user).

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/deal
# Add the body with no mandatory fields:
{noformat}{
  "description_text": "Team 5 Test no mandatory fields",
  "funnel_custom_funnel1": "1724748016077x923297551481141200",
  "lead_custom_lead": "1725010563849x249896618869343900",
  "note_list_custom_note": [
    "1627393624856x199214596987551740"
  ],
  "stage_custom_stage": "1678718571924x727404269818871800"
}{noformat}

*Expected result:*

(/)  Error code: 401 Unauthorized. Error message displayed: "Permission denied: cannot create this object"

*Actual result:*

(x)  A new deal without mandatory fields  is successfully created - 201Created.

!deal no mandatory fields 201.jpg|width=1258,height=594,alt="deal no mandatory fields 201.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Deals API - Possible to get the deal by ID without authorization
column27:
It is possible to get the deal by Id without being authorized.

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/deal/:UniqueID 
# In the Authorization tab of the request, select the "*No auth*" option instead of “Inherit auth from parent.”

*Expected result:*

(/)  The request should return a *401Unauthorized* error - {{"You do not have permission to get this object"}}

*Actual result:*

(x)  The unauthorized request returns a *200OK* response.

!Deal by Id no auth.jpg|width=1312,height=580,alt="Deal by Id no auth.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Leads API - Possible to create a lead with empty fields
column27:
It is possible to create a new lead with empty fields. *NB*: company_text email_text are required fields. There is a separate bug for that.

*Steps:*

# Send POST request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/lead with all fields left empty, as shown below: 
{noformat}{
  "company_text": "",
  "email_text": "",
  "full_name_text": ""
}{noformat}

*Expected result:*

(/)  The expected error type would be a _400 Bad Request_. This response indicates that the server could not process the request due to invalid input, since the creation of a lead requires certain parameters` input. 

*Actual result:*

(x)  *201Created* result is returned when creating a new lead with empty fields.

!leads empty fields.jpg|width=1255,height=579,alt="leads empty fields.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Leads API - Possible to create a new lead with full_name_text over 50 symbols
column27:
The system allows creating a new lead with full_name_text field over 50 symbols.

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/lead 
# Add the body as shown in the example below (full_name_text field has 55 symbols) :
{noformat}{
  "company_text": "Team 5.3",
  "email_text": "randomemail2@gmail.com",
  "full_name_text": "Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5Team5"
}{noformat}

*Expected result:*

(/)  Instead of successfully creating a new lead, the API should return an error response with the informative error message that the full_name_text field allows  maximum 50 symbols.

*Actual result:*

(x)  A new lead with full_name_text field over 50 symbols is successfully created - *201Created.*

column1: Leads API - No error when validating incorrect data types
column27:
When checking for incorrect data types across various parameters, no errors are generated, and the validation is considered successful, resulting in a 200 OK status code.

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/lead 
# Try: set *limit* parameter value to -  boolean (true or false)
# Try: set *cursor* parameter value to - boolean (true or false)

*Expected result:*

(/)  Instead of getting a 200OK response, the API should return a client error response, such as: HTTP Status Code 400 (Bad Request)

*Example of a Possible Error Response:* 

{noformat}{
    "error": {
        "code": 400,
        "message": "Invalid data type for 'cursor': expected integer, received boolean."
    }
}{noformat}

*Actual result:*

(x)  The validations with incorrect data types are considered successful, resulting in a 200 OK status code.

!leads limit boolean.jpg|width=1246,height=577,alt="leads limit boolean.jpg"!

!leads cursor true.jpg|width=1260,height=529,alt="leads cursor true.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Stages API - No error when replaces parameters with incorrect data types (color_option_colors - boolean)
column27:
When replacing the {{color_option_colors}} with the wrong data type (boolean instead of string), no errors are generated, and the validation is considered successful, resulting in a *204No Content* status code. In this case, we expect the system to return a  400 *Bad Request* error code.

*Steps:*

# Send PUT request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/stage/:UniqueID
# Set {{color_option_colors}} value to boolean (true or false)

*Expected result:*

(/)  Instead of getting a 204No Content response, the API should return a client error response, such as: HTTP Status Code 400 (Bad Request)

*Actual result:*

(x)  The request with incorrect data type is considered successful, resulting in a 204 No Content result.

!PUT stage color boolean.jpg|width=1219,height=552,alt="PUT stage color boolean.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Stages API - Possible to create a stage with name_text 21+ characters
column27:
It is possible to create a new stage in Postman with a stage name over 21 characters (The CRMY states that *Stage name can only be 21 characters*).

!stage name 21.jpg|width=435,height=211,alt="stage name 21.jpg"!

*Steps:*

# Send POST request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/stage with the name_text over 21 symbols, as shown below: 
{noformat}{
  "color_option_colors": "Pinkish",
  "deals_list_custom_deal1": [],
  "funnel_custom_funnel1": "1724677207945x687761705721445400",
  "name_text": "stagestagestagestagestage"
}{noformat}

*Expected result:*

(/)  The expected error type would typically be a _400 Bad Request_.

*Response Example:*

{noformat}{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Validation Error",
  "message": "The 'name_text' field must not exceed 21 characters. Please shorten the name to meet the character limit."
}{noformat}

*Actual result:*

(x)  *201Created* result is returned when creating a new stage with a stage name over 21 characters.

!stage 25 characters.jpg|width=1159,height=606,alt="stage 25 characters.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Stages API - Wrong sorting order sort_field name_text
column27:
Stages sorting by name_text by both descending=true and descending=false returns incorrect results. E.g., in both requests (with descending=true and descending=false, sort_field name_text) the order is:

# {{"name_text": "Initialize "}}
# {{"name_text": "Revise  "}}
# {{"name_text": "Determine goals "}}
# {{"name_text": "Build the concept "}}
# {{"name_text": "Initial Contact "}} , etc.

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/stage?sort_field =name_text 
# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/stage?sort_field =name_text&descending=true
# Verify that in both cases the sorting has wrong order

*Expected result:*

(/)  For the sorting order by name_text, the objects should be sorted in alphabetical order ASC:  A to Z.

(/) For the sorting order by name_text & descending=true, the objects should be sorted in alphabetical order DESC.



*Actual result:*

(x)  Both requests return the list of objects sorted by_name (asc or desc) in a random order.



!stages sorting desc wrong.mp4|width=1126,height=650,alt="stages sorting desc wrong.mp4"!



!stages sorting name wrong.mp4|width=1112,height=638,alt="stages sorting name wrong.mp4"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Stages API - Wrong or no error when validating incorrect data types
column27:
When checking for incorrect data types across various parameters, no errors are generated, and the validation is considered successful, resulting in a 200 OK status code. In the case of retrieving a stage by UniqueID with the wrong data type (e.g., boolean), the system still validates it as a string and returns a  404 *Not Found* error code.

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/stage
# Try: set *limit* parameter value to boolean (true or false);
# Try: set *cursor* parameter value to string (e.g., example@example.com)
# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/stage/:UniqueID
# Try: set UniqueID value to boolean (true or false)

*Expected result:*

(/)  Instead of getting a 200OK response, the API should return a client error response, such as: HTTP Status Code 400 (Bad Request)

*Example of a Possible Error Response:* 

{noformat}{
    "error": {
        "code": 400,
        "message": "Invalid data type for 'cursor': expected integer, received string."
    }
}{noformat}

*Actual result:*

(x)  The validations with incorrect data types are considered successful, resulting in a 200 OK status code or 404 Not Found error code.



!stages cursor string.jpg|width=1090,height=621,alt="stages cursor string.jpg"!

!stages limit boolean.jpg|width=1096,height=652,alt="stages limit boolean.jpg"!

!stage uniqueid boolean.jpg|width=1107,height=622,alt="stage uniqueid boolean.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Funnels API - Wrong error code when the expected Id type does not match the provided type
column27:
* The expected error when sending a DELETE request for funnels with an incorrect data type (boolean instead of a string for a unique ID) could likely be _a validation error or a 400 Bad Request response_, indicating that the provided type does not match the expected type. However, the system still treats the boolean data as a string and returns a *404Not Found error.*
* When trying to retrieve the funnel by invalid Id type (number instead of string),  the system also treats the integer data as a string and returns a *404Not Found error.*

*Steps:*

# Send DELETE request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/funnel/:UniqueID
# Add a boolean value (true or false) as a UniqueID.
# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/funnel/:UniqueID
# Add a number as a UniqueID.

*Expected result:*

(/)  We should get _a validation error or a 400 Bad Request response_, indicating that the provided type does not match the expected type.  -{{"Invalid data for field UniqueID: Expected a string, but got a boolean"}} (example)

*Actual result:*

(x) The system still treats the boolean data as a string and returns a *404Not Found error.*

{noformat}{
    "statusCode": 404,
    "body": {
        "status": "MISSING_DATA",
        "message": "Missing object of type funnel: object with id false does not exist"
    }
}{noformat}

!funeel id number.jpg|width=1278,height=487,alt="funeel id number.jpg"!



!delete wrong data type 404 (4136dca5-4539-48bf-8065-8a167851bde5).jpg|width=1243,height=658,alt="delete wrong data type 404.jpg"!
column28:
Windows 11 Home OS build: 22631.4037, Google Chrome Version: 126.0.6478.62

Postman for Web Version 11.10.0-240820-1117

column1: Funnels API - Possible to retrieve the list of funnels without authorization
column27:
It is possible to retrieve the list of funnels without requiring authorization.

*Steps:*

# Send GET request to url: https://cerebrumhubcrmlite.bubbleapps.io/api/1.1/obj/funnel
# In the Authorization tab of the request, select the "*No auth*" option instead of “Inherit auth from parent.”

*Expected result:*

(/)  The request should return a *401Unauthorized* error.

*Actual result:*

(x)  The unauthorized request returns a *200OK* response.

!No auth list of tunnels.mp4|width=1234,height=692,alt="No auth list of tunnels.mp4"!
